thread.title: Miss Colorado to speak at Atlantic City nurses convention
thread.title_full: Miss Colorado to speak at Atlantic City nurses convention | NJ.com

author: Amy Kuperinsky | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Miss Colorado to speak at Atlantic City nurses convention
text:
Instead of singing, dancing, or playing an instrument at the Miss America pageant, Kelley Johnson, Miss Colorado , recited a monologue as her talent.
Johnson, a nurse, made waves as she relayed an anecdote from one of her experiences with a patient named Joe who suffered from Alzheimer's disease. Yet after the September pageant, Miss Colorado, who was second runner-up in the competition, became the target of some criticism from Michelle Collins and Joy Behar, hosts on " The View ." Their remarks ignited a controversy that ensured Miss Colorado would stay in the spotlight past the pageant.
Now, Johnson, 22, will return to Atlantic City as a keynote speaker at the New Jersey State Nurses Association's annual convention at Bally's on Oct. 15. The pageant alumna will address "the aftermath and benefits of the controversy" as well as "why nurses choose nursing and how nursing continues to choose nurses."
RELATED: Miss America 2016: Watch Miss Colorado deliver monologue about being a nurse The criticisms from "The View" hosts — namely that her monologue sounded like she was reading emails, and mockery of her choice to wear scrubs and a "doctor's stethoscope" on stage — were received with interest by nurses across the country. Many stormed social media in support of Johnson , posting pictures of their stethoscopes.
